alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, northern Warren, south central Rock Island, Mercer, southwestern Henry, central Des Moines, southeastern Louisa and northeastern Lee Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sherrard to Middletown. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Matherville and Boden around 705 PM CDT. Sherrard around 710 PM CDT. Burlington and Cable around 715 PM CDT. Orion around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Gulf Port, Dallas City, Woodhull, New Windsor, Alpha, Andover, Carman, Lynn Center and New Windsor. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 20 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren
